content.text:
# Draft:Timeline of the Philippine Basketball Association

The Philippine Basketball Association is a men's professional basketball league in the Philippines. The league is currently composed of twelve company-owned teams.
Timeline
1975–1989: Constant changes
1990–1999: Eight teams
1995 All-Filipino Cup
* The Swift Mighty Meaties were renamed to the Sunkist Orange Juicers.
* The Tondeña 65 Rhum Masters were renamed to the Ginebra San Miguel.
{| class="wikitable"
|+ 1995 PBA All-Filipino Cup teams
|-
| Alaska Milkmen
| San Miguel Beermen
|-
| Ginebra San Miguel
| Shell Rimula X Turbo Chargers
|-
| Pepsi Mega Bottlers
| Sta. Lucia Realtors
|-
| Purefoods Tender Juicy Hotdogs
| Sunkist Orange Juicers
|}
1995 Commissioner's Cup
* The Shell Rimula X Turbo Chargers were renamed to the Formula Shell Gas Kings.
{| class="wikitable"
|+ 1995 PBA Commissioner's Cup teams
|-
| Alaska Milkmen
| Purefoods Tender Juicy Hotdogs
|-
| Formula Shell Gas Kings
| San Miguel Beermen
|-
| Ginebra San Miguel
| Sta. Lucia Realtors
|-
| Pepsi Mega Bottlers
| Sunkist Orange Juicers
|}
1995 Governors' Cup
* The Formula Shell Gas Kings were renamed to the Formula Shell Zoom Masters.
{| class="wikitable"
|+ Philippine Basketball Association teams  1995 Governors' Cup to 1996 All-Filipino Cup
|-
| Alaska Milkmen
| Purefoods Tender Juicy Hotdogs
|-
| Formula Shell Zoom Masters
| San Miguel Beermen
|-
| Ginebra San Miguel
| Sta. Lucia Realtors

| Pepsi Mega Bottlers
| Sunkist Orange Juicers

1996 Commissioner's Cup
* The Pepsi Mega Bottlers franchise was transferred to Lapanday Holdings and the Pilipino Telephone Corporation and were renamed to the Mobiline Cellulars.
* The Sunkist Orange Juicers were renamed to the Sunkist Orange Bottlers.
{| class="wikitable"
|+ Philippine Basketball Association teams  1996 Commissioner's Cup to 1996 Governors' Cup
|-
| Alaska Milkmen
| Purefoods Tender Juicy Hotdogs
|-
| Formula Shell Zoom Masters
| San Miguel Beermen
|-
| Ginebra San Miguel
| Sta. Lucia Realtors
|-
| Mobiline Cellulars
| Sunkist Orange Bottlers
|}
1997 All-Filipino Cup
* The Ginebra San Miguel was renamed to the Gordon's Gin Boars.
* The Purefoods Tender Juicy Hotdogs were renamed to the Purefoods Corned Beef Cowboys.
* The Sunkist Orange Bottlers were renamed to Pop Cola Bottlers.
{| class="wikitable"
|+ Philippine Basketball Association teams  1997 All-Filipino Cup to 1997 Commissioner's Cup
|-
| Alaska Milkmen
| Purefoods Corned Beef Cowboys
|-
| Formula Shell Zoom Masters
| San Miguel Beermen

| Sta. Lucia Realtors

1997 Governors' Cup
* The Pop Cola Bottlers were renamed to the Pop Cola Sizzlers.
* The Purefoods Corned Beef Cowboys were renamed to the Purefoods Carne Norte Beefies.
{| class="wikitable"
|+ 1997 PBA Governors' Cup teams

1998 All-Filipino Cup
* The Mobiline Cellulars were renamed to the Mobiline Phone Pals.
* The Pop Cola Sizzlers were renamed to the Pop Cola 800s.
{| class="wikitable"
|+ 1998 PBA All-Filipino Cup teams

| Sta. Lucia Realtors
|}
1998 Commissioner's Cup
* The Gordon's Gin Boars were renamed to the Ginebra San Miguel
* The Purefoods Carne Norte Beefies were renamed to the Purefoods Tender Juicy Hotdogs.
* The Philippine Centennial Team competed as a guest team in the 1998 PBA Centennial Cup.
{| class="wikitable"

1999 All-Filipino Cup: Tanduay rejoins
* The Tanduay franchise rejoined the league as an expansion team. The team went by the Tanduay Gold Rhum Masters.
* The Ginebra San Miguel was renamed to the Barangay Ginebra Kings
{| class="wikitable"
| style="background-color:#8DB600;font-size: 90%;" | Rejoined PBA **
|}

2000–2014: Ten teams
2000 All-Filipino Cup: Red Bull debuts
* The Batang Red Bull Energizers joined the league as an expansion team.

2000 Commissioner's Cup
* The Batang Red Bull Energizers were renamed to the Batang Red Bull Thunder.
* The Pop Cola 800s were renamed to the Sunkist Orange Juicers.
* The Shell Velocity was renamed to the Shell Turbo Chargers.

* The Alaska Milkmen were renamed to the Alaska Aces.
* The Batang Red Bull Thunder were renamed to the Red Bull Thunder.

2002 Governors' Cup: Pop Cola and Tanduay depart, Coca-Cola and FedEx debut
* The Pop Cola Panthers were sold to Coca-Cola Bottlers Philippines and became the Coca-Cola Tigers. The team debuted in this conference.
* The Tanduay Rhum Masters were sold to the Lina Group and became the FedEx Express. The team also debuted in this conference.
* Hapee Toothpaste and Selecta Ice Cream competed as guest teams in the 2002 Governors' Cup, with the latter also competing in the 2002 Commissioner's Cup.
{| class="wikitable"
| style="background-color:#00FF00;font-size: 90%;" | 2002 Governors' Cup is first conference in PBA *
|}

|+ Philippine Basketball Association teams  2002 Governors' Cup to 2003 All-Filipino Cup

| Alaska Aces

|-

2003 Invitational Championship
* The Red Bull Thunder was renamed to the Red Bull Barako.
* The Jilin Northeast Tigers (as Magnolia–Jilin), KK Novi Sad, Yonsei University, and the Philippines national team (as Cebuana Lhuillier) competed as guest teams in this conference.
{| class="wikitable"
| style="background-color:#D8BFD8;font-size: 90%;" | 2005 Fiesta Conference is last conference in PBA †
|}

2005–06 Fiesta Conference: Shell departs
* The Shell Turbo Chargers departed the league.
* The FedEx Express was renamed to the Air21 Express.
* The Purefoods Tender Juicy Hotdogs were renamed to the Purefoods Chunkee Giants.

* The Welcoat Dragons debuted in this conference after acquiring the Shell Turbo Chargers franchise a season prior.

2008–09 Philippine Cup
* The Magnolia Beverage Masters were renamed to the San Miguel Beermen.
* The Talk 'N Text Phone Pals were renamed to the Talk 'N Text Tropang Texters.
* The Welcoat Dragons were renamed to the Rain or Shine Elasto Painters.

* The Red Bull Barako was renamed to the Barako Bull Energy Boosters.
* Smart Gilas competed as a guest team in the 2009–10 Philippine Cup.

* The Burger King Whoppers were renamed to the Air21 Express.
* The Purefoods Tender Juicy Giants were renamed to the B-Meg Derby Ace Llamados.

2010–11 Philippine Cup: Sta. Lucia departs, Meralco debuts
* The Sta. Lucia Realtors were acquired by Meralco and became the Meralco Bolts. The team debuted in this conference.
* The Coca-Cola Tigers were renamed as the Powerade Tigers.
{| class="wikitable"
| style="background-color:#00FF00;font-size: 90%;" | First conference in PBA *

2011 Commissioner's Cup: Barako Bull departs
* The Barako Bull Energy Boosters departed the league.
* Smart Gilas returned as a guest team in this conference.

2011–12 Philippine Cup: Shopinas debuts
* The Barako Bull Energy Boosters were acquired by the Lina Group and became the Shopinas.com Clickers. The team debuted at in this conference.
* The Air21 Express was renamed to the Barako Bull Energy.
* The B-Meg Derby Ace Llamados were renamed to the B-Meg Llamados

* The Shopinas.com Clickers were renamed to the Air21 Express.

2012–13 Philippine Cup: Powerade departs, GlobalPort debuts
* The Powerade Tigers were acquired by Sultan 900, Inc. and became the GlobalPort Batang Pier.
* The B-Meg Llamados were renamed to the San Mig Coffee Mixers.
* The Barangay Ginebra Kings were renamed to the Barangay Ginebra San Miguel.

2015–present: Twelve teams
2014–15 Philippine Cup: Air21 II departs; Blackwater, Kia and NLEX debut
* The Blackwater Elite and Kia Sorento joined the league as expansion teams.
* The Air21 Express were acquired by Manila North Tollways Corporation and became the NLEX Road Warriors. The team debuted in this conference.
* The San Mig Super Coffee Mixers were renamed to the Purefoods Star Hotshots.

* The Talk 'N Text Tropang Texters were renamed to the TNT Tropang Texters.

2016 Commissioners' Cup: Barako Bull II departs, Phoenix debuts
* The Barako Bull Energy was acquired by Phoenix Petroleum and became the Phoenix Fuel Masters. The team debuted in this conference.
* The TNT Tropang Texters were renamed to Tropang TNT.

2022 Philippine Cup: Alaska departs, Converge debuts
* The Alaska Aces were acquired by Converge ICT and became the Converge FiberXers. The team debuted in this conference.
* The Magnolia Pambansang Manok Hotshots were renamed to the Magnolia Chicken Timplados Hotshots.
* The Bay Area Dragons competed as a guest team during the 2022–23 PBA Commissioner's Cup.
